data.title: Susan Marx, 94, Actress and Harpo's Wife
data.meta_description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP) — Susan Marx, who appeared in more than a dozen films in the 1930's opposite such stars as John Wayne and W. C. Fields and later married the comedian Harpo Marx, died on Dec. 22.
data.text:
RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., Jan. 4 (AP) — Susan Marx, who appeared in more than a dozen films in the 1930's opposite such stars as John Wayne and W. C. Fields and later married the comedian Harpo Marx, died on Dec. 22.

She was 94.

Mrs. Marx, who was born Susan Fleming, started her career in New York during the 1920's, appearing in "The Ziegfeld Follies" on Broadway.

She moved to Hollywood in the early 1930's to appear as Wayne's love interest in the western "Range Feud" and as Fields's daughter in the comedy "Million Dollar Legs."

While working for Paramount, she met and married Harpo Marx. They adopted four children and later settled in Rancho Mirage, which became a popular hideaway for Hollywood stars.
